DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Identification Tumor Site Current Coding System Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The codes that best describe how the primary site currently is coded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Identification Tumor Site Current Coding System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: System for how the primary site currently is coded.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: (NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:Named locations of, or within, the body.:Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
Named locations of or within the body.
Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Tumor Site Coding System Number Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An abnormal tissue growth resulted from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant ones exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias. -- 2004_Position in relation to the surroundings._The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis. (from Wikipedia)_a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis. (from Wikipedia):a group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
